it surprising that Washington Examiner writer Mike Pence Barone would contend`` old rules don't apply to'' the 2012 Republican primary election campaign even though every Republican presidential nominee since Ronald Reagan in 1980 has been pro-life. The next rule that needs to be debunked is that Republican candidates must pass a litmus test on cultural issues, especially abortion. This was true in 1988, 1996 and 2000, when religious conservatives were a newly energized political force and one stirred to action by Bill Clinton 's misconduct, he writes.`` But Sept. 11 changed a lot of things, including this old rule.
